name: Deutsches Architekturmuseum
description: Celebrates architecture with rotating exhibitions, models, and interactive displays housed in a historic villa.

name: MAIN TOWER Observation Deck
description: Offers panoramic views of Frankfurt from one of its tallest skyscrapers, with glass walls and an outdoor terrace.

name: Roßmarkt
description: Historic square surrounded by shopping and dining options, often hosting events and seasonal markets.

name: Römerberg
description: picturesque town square; the historical focal point of the city, a cobbled plaza lined with original and reconstructed half-timber medieval buildings including the Römer (Frankfurt’s town hall) and the Alte Nikolaikirche (St Nicholas’ Church), which you can visit if there are no meetings or events on.

name: Iron Footbridge
description: Fantastic views and thousands of love locks.

name: Alter Flugplatz Frankfurt am Main
description: Revitalization efforts converted a former U.S. military heliport into a sprawling urban park.

name: Frankfurt Cathedral
description: A towering Gothic cathedral that hosted Holy Roman Empire coronations; climb the tower for city views.

name: Historisches Museum Frankfurt
description: Covers Frankfurt’s history from the Middle Ages to today, with interactive exhibits and city models.

name: Städel Museum
description: One of Germany’s most important art museums, housing European masterpieces from the 14th century to modern times.

name: Verkehrsmuseum Frankfurt am Main
description: This museum explores the history of the city's public transportation. Its collection includes the world's oldest preserved electric trolley car.

name: Kleinmarkthalle
description: Indoor food market offering local specialties, wines, flowers, and international treats—a local favorite for snacks and gifts.

name: Flemings Selection Hotel Frankfurt-City - paternoster
description: The lift is currently working, although passengers can only disembark on the top floor when the bar is open (starting at 5:30 pm) . Otherwise you get out on the 5th floor and walk up one flight of stairs.

name: IG Farben Building
description: From Nazi chemicals to the CIA, this architectural marvel has played a fascinating role in German history.

name: Dialog Museum
description: This unique exhibit "Dialogue in the Dark" reverses roles as the visionless become guides and the sighted become ‘blind.’

name: Pinkelbaum
description: After years of being casually peed on by humans, this tree is peeing back.

name: Bockenheimer Warte
description: The entrance to this Frankfurt subway station looks like an old tram car crashed into the concrete sidewalk.

name: Apfelwein Wagner
description: Traditional tavern serving Frankfurt’s iconic apple wine (Apfelwein) and hearty Hessian fare in a cozy, wood-paneled setting.

name: Museum Applied Art
description: Houses decorative arts and design from around the world in a striking Richard Meier-designed building.

name: Zum Gemalten Haus
description: Famous for its hand-painted façade and traditional Apfelwein, this rustic pub is a classic Sachsenhausen stop.

name: Mal Seh'n cinema e.V.
description: A beloved indie cinema known for arthouse films, festivals, and its cozy, intimate atmosphere.

name: Bauernmarkt Konstablerwache
description: thursday and saturday there's always a weekly regional farmers market on top of the train station "Konstablerwache"(it's in the city centre) they offer some very good sausages and there's also one sausage stand that sells apple juice as well, it's so good. There's also a tiny butchers cart hidden in the back he sells a very good pulled beef sandwich for very cheap and there's also a foodtruck which sells dairy products (ice cream, milkshakes etc.

name: Goetheturm
description: A 43-meter wooden observation tower in the city forest, offering panoramic views and peaceful trails.

name: Goethe House
description: Birthplace of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, now a museum showcasing period furnishings and the writer’s legacy.

name: Alte Oper
description:
Frankfurt's most beautiful concert hall hosts pop and jazz concerts, musicals and a festival that makes classical music accessible to everyone. Everything but operas.

If she were a person, you could call her the "grande dame" of Frankfurt's cultural institutions: the Alte Oper. ...

name: Café im Liebieghaus
description: Charming garden café located inside the sculpture museum—perfect for coffee and cake among marble statues.

name: Höchster Schloßplatz
description: Historic square in the Höchst district featuring a medieval castle, cobbled streets, and occasional markets.

name: Museumsufer
description: The strip holds thirteen of the city's museums, all located in wonderfully restored villas from the 1900s set between structures dating back to the 1800s. Internationally acclaimed architects such as Richard Meier and Oswald Mathias Ungers have extended the existing buildings with modern additions. Museums found here include the Film Museum, the Museum of Applied Art, the Jewish Museum and the Architecture Museum
